channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple potholes for years. Generally just a very bad part of Grafton Road. Rather than just keep "patching up" the road it would make more financial sense to completely resurface it. The double yellow lines could also do with painting again. The rest of Grafton road is lovely but the area off the Bath road reallyblets it down!!, 8th April
item.description:
Outside number 30 and 31 Grafton Road GL50 2DE

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Grafton Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees damaging our wall and blocking light, 8th April
item.description:
The trees are in Parabola Close and planted on the verge inside the double yellow line very close to the back wall of our property Hadley House, Bayshill Road, Cheltenham, GL50 3AW. Our wall is showing signs of cracking - see photo 3. The trees have grown very fast and starting to take light. They also sway alarmingly in the wind and could fall, further damaging out wall. I understand they may have been planted by the owner of the cottages on the west side of Parabola Close but on land owned by the County Council and not by them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Parabola Close, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
